Articles.Content:
At the moment I'm busy grinding the cogs in my head, trying to think of what I should do for a cinematic. The filming and general artsy type stuff is the easy part, however getting a spark to get your brain whirring is not. So if you have any ships you want to see in a cinematic and you have a loose idea of a story then I'm up for it! I'm aiming around 2 minutes 30 seconds so make whatever your thinking of into a quick short (skipping out scenes that do nothing but bring context is generally how I roll). I must add that this thread is indeed opensource, so if you see an idea you like then you can pinch it and turn it into a cinematic yourself.

Here's some work, I did not to long ago, if you want to be sure that your idea/ship is going to a good cause:

(

)

PS: I'm not sure if this should be in mission control or not, but then again I'm not exactly showcasing my work, purely setting up a thread for people to share ideas for cinematics.

Mmm I've always wanted to be able to create cinematics but, on top of lacking the creativity side, I lack the movie editing ability/software haha. As for ideas, Nassault always seems to do videos about tragic missions, maybe you could recreate Apollo 13 (I know it wasn't tragic but that might be cool.) You could definitely attempt the free return trajectory from the Mun, allowing you a challenge in-game on top of making the movie itself.

I don't know about doing a cinematic based on a historical event, the thing with doing a fictional story is that you can do whatever you want: without any constraints on creativity. Although an amazing occurrence, that I will no doubt produce a cinematic of in the future, Apollo 13 just isn't what I'm looking for. I'm in need of a stencil that I can, more or less, "colour in" and produce a cinematic out of that original idea.

Mmm fair enough, that was really my only idea hehe. You could do the usual "jeb gets stuck on a planet and you have to sent a rescue craft in" but I think that's been done a few times already. Maybe you could make it from the perspective of a summer holiday throughout the Joolean system or something.

Or, if you want a darker side, a holiday that goes wrong. Maybe their spacecraft gets hit by an orbiting satellite and they have to go through emergency measure to abandon ship (yes, kind of like Gravity, I know, but you could put your own spin on it)

YES.

Pure genius in mere words.
One thing I've always wondered is: how to get that smooth changing of camera aimpoint? I now how to move it with the mouse, but I don't off-hand know a nice way to do it.
In the cinematic business we use kerbcam (a mod) to get those smooth shots

YES.

Pure genius in mere words.

I'd be interested to see how you manage to get a satellite to collide with your ship without blowing it completely to pieces... However you do it, keep us posted!
